intro: Glochidion grantii, commonly known as the broad-leaf glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruits are capsules that split open to release seeds. Glochidion grantii is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
